summary: This document is an email chain from January 2021 regarding the FOIA case 'Times v. BOP, 20-cv-833' concerning Jeffrey Epstein. It involves coordination between government attorneys and the Bureau of Prisons (BOP) regarding the review and production of documents, including attorney visit logs and count slips from Epstein's incarceration, with specific attention to redactions and the perspective of another inmate, Tartaglione.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The FOIA case concerns records related to his incarceration, including attorney visit logs and count slips.

persons.name: Tartaglione
persons.context: His name appears on a SHU roster in the BOP documents; the email chain seeks confirmation that there are no issues from his legal team regarding the document production.

events.title: Planned FOIA Production Deadline
events.description: The Bureau of Prisons (BOP) is scheduled to produce documents in response to the FOIA case 'Times v. BOP, 20-cv-833' concerning Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: Declaration Due Date
events.description: A declaration supporting certain redactions (b7a) in the FOIA production is due.

locations: 86 Chambers Street, Third Floor, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: The email chain discusses the imminent production of Bureau of Prisons (BOP) records related to Jeffrey Epstein in response to a FOIA lawsuit filed by The Times.
The production includes approximately 26 pages from BOP, containing attorney visit logs for Epstein and a SHU roster mentioning inmate Tartaglione.
Documents include 'translucent' versions showing proposed redactions (marked green) and 'production' versions; count slips were withheld in full.
Coordination involves ensuring redactions are properly applied under legal exemptions (b6, b7a, b7c) and that Tartaglione's team has no objections.
The correspondence reveals procedural details of government document review and redaction processes in a high-profile FOIA case.
